MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: This encompasses the candidate's hands-on experience and understanding of relevant technologies, programming languages, and development tools. It includes their ability to apply this knowledge to design, develop, and maintain software systems.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through resume review focusing on listed technologies, years of experience with each, and project descriptions highlighting their application. Use technical interview questions and coding challenges to evaluate practical skills in C#, .NET, SQL, SSRS, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and related technologies. Evaluate the candidate's ability to explain technical concepts and problem-solving approaches.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited practical experience; struggles with fundamental concepts and requires significant guidance to complete basic tasks.
Demonstrates basic understanding of core technologies and can complete simple tasks with moderate supervision. Requires guidance on more complex issues.
Proficient in core technologies; independently handles most tasks and demonstrates the ability to learn new technologies quickly. Contributes to code reviews effectively.

Expert in multiple relevant technologies; independently designs, develops, and maintains complex systems. Mentors junior developers and contributes to architectural decisions. Exhibits mastery in troubleshooting and performance tuning.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: This category assesses the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions. It includes their ability to think critically, troubleshoot issues, and make informed decisions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate through behavioral interview questions focusing on past experiences with challenging technical problems. Use technical interview questions designed to assess problem-solving skills. Assess the candidate's ability to break down complex problems into smaller, manageable components and their ability to identify potential solutions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze problems and requires significant guidance to identify solutions. Unable to troubleshoot effectively.
Can analyze simple problems and identify basic solutions with moderate guidance. Requires assistance with troubleshooting complex issues.
Independently analyzes complex problems and develops effective solutions. Demonstrates strong troubleshooting skills and identifies root causes effectively.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; proactively identifies and addresses potential problems. Develops innovative solutions and mentors others in problem-solving techniques.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration Skills: This category evaluates the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. It includes their ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, share knowledge, and provide constructive feedback.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through behavioral interview questions focusing on past experiences working in teams. Observe the candidate's communication style during the interview process. Evaluate their ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely. Assess their ability to actively listen and respond to questions thoughtfully.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to communicate effectively and collaborate with others. Difficulty explaining technical concepts and providing constructive feedback.
Communicates adequately and collaborates effectively with minimal guidance. Requires improvement in explaining complex technical concepts.
Communicates clearly and concisely, collaborating effectively in a team environment. Shares knowledge and provides constructive feedback effectively.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills; proactively shares knowledge and mentors others. Facilitates effective team communication and collaboration across multiple teams.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Knowledge: This assesses the candidate's understanding and experience with the various stages of the SDLC, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment. It also includes knowledge of Agile methodologies.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess through interview questions about their experience with different SDLC models, particularly Agile. Ask about their role in different phases of past projects. Evaluate their understanding of version control systems, testing methodologies, and deployment strategies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of SDLC concepts and Agile methodologies. Requires significant guidance in all phases of the SDLC.
Basic understanding of SDLC concepts and Agile methodologies. Participates in some phases of the SDLC with moderate guidance.
Solid understanding of SDLC concepts and Agile methodologies. Independently manages tasks within different phases of the SDLC and contributes to process improvement.
Expert knowledge of SDLC concepts and Agile methodologies. Leads and mentors others in implementing best practices throughout the SDLC. Drives process improvements and innovation.

MainCategory.Description: Customer Focus and Service Orientation:  This evaluates the candidate's commitment to providing excellent customer service and their ability to understand and meet the needs of both internal and external customers.  Focus is on honest and reliable service, reflecting FirstWatch's values.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Utilize behavioral interview questions that explore situations where the candidate had to prioritize customer needs or resolve customer issues.  Assess their understanding of the importance of customer satisfaction and their ability to empathize with customers' concerns. Look for examples of initiative in exceeding customer expectations.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Shows little awareness of customer needs and struggles to prioritize customer satisfaction. Avoids customer interaction or demonstrates poor communication skills.
Understands basic customer service principles and attempts to meet customer needs with some prompting. May struggle with complex or demanding customer interactions.
Demonstrates a strong customer focus and proactively seeks to understand and meet customer needs. Effectively communicates with customers and resolves issues efficiently.

Exemplifies exceptional customer service skills and goes above and beyond to exceed customer expectations. Advocates for customer needs and influences others to prioritize customer satisfaction. Anticipates future customer needs and proactively develops solutions.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Maintainability: Assesses the candidate's ability to write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples provided by the candidate, focusing on code clarity, comments, and adherence to coding standards. Assess their understanding of code refactoring techniques and best practices.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is difficult to understand, poorly documented, and violates coding standards.
Code is functional but lacks proper documentation and maintainability.
Code is clean, well-documented, and adheres to coding standards, promoting maintainability.

SubCategory.Description: Testing and Debugging:  Evaluates the candidate's skills in writing unit tests, integration tests, and debugging complex software issues.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess their experience with different testing frameworks and debugging tools. Ask about their approach to identifying and resolving bugs. Evaluate their ability to write effective test cases.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with testing and debugging. Struggles to write basic unit tests or identify root causes of bugs.
Basic understanding of testing and debugging principles. Can write simple unit tests and debug straightforward issues with some assistance.
Proficient in writing unit tests, integration tests, and debugging complex software issues. Independently identifies and resolves bugs efficiently.

SubCategory.Description: Database Skills: Assesses the candidate's proficiency with database technologies, including SQL, database design, and data modeling.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Use SQL coding challenges to evaluate their ability to write efficient queries. Ask about their experience with database design principles and data modeling techniques. Assess their understanding of database performance optimization.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of database concepts and SQL syntax. Struggles to write basic queries or design simple databases.
Basic understanding of database concepts and SQL syntax. Can write simple queries and design basic databases with some assistance.
Proficient in SQL, database design, and data modeling. Can write efficient queries, design complex databases, and optimize database performance.

SubCategory.Description: System Configuration and Support: This assesses the candidate's ability to maintain and modify software and system configurations in production, staged, and test environments.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask about their experience with system configuration management tools and techniques. Evaluate their understanding of server operating systems, networking concepts, and security best practices. Assess their ability to troubleshoot system configuration issues.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with system configuration and support. Requires significant guidance to perform basic tasks.
Basic understanding of system configuration and support principles. Can perform simple tasks with moderate assistance.
Proficient in system configuration and support. Independently maintains and modifies software and system configurations, troubleshoots issues effectively, and implements security best practices.

SubCategory.Description: Continuous Learning and Adaptability: Evaluates the candidate's desire and ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask about their approach to staying up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry trends. Assess their ability to learn new technologies quickly and apply them to real-world problems. Evaluate their willingness to embrace new challenges and adapt to changing project requirements.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Shows little interest in learning new technologies and struggles to adapt to changing requirements.
Willing to learn new technologies but requires significant guidance and support.
Demonstrates a strong desire to learn new technologies and adapts quickly to changing requirements. Proactively seeks out new challenges and embraces innovation.
